title: Business & Finance
text:
U.S. investors have borne the brunt of a Trump executive order that was meant to hit the Chinese military by curtailing access to American dollars.

Beijing hit back against recent U.S. curbs targeting Chinese companies, saying it plans to ban Chinese firms and citizens from complying with foreign laws and sanctions it deems unjustified.

---

Investors are showing signs of increasing exuberance, reflecting optimism about a vaccine-fueled global recovery and the changed economics of the post-coronavirus world.

---

A chip shortage that has disrupted vehicle production elsewhere is reaching the U.S., stifling output for major car companies.

---

Chinese electric-vehicle startup NIO unveiled its fourth production model as it prepares for a challenge from Tesla.

---

Boeing faces legal and business challenges even after its $2.5 billion agreement to end a criminal investigation into the 737 MAX debacle.
